column1: What should the feminist movement focus on?
column2: reordering society to counteract and replace patriarchal ideologies
column4: creating a culture that celebrates women and centers their experiences
column6: establishing equal rights for men and women at all stages of their lives
column8: recognizing that we must move behind singular, monolithic identifiers when advocating for equity

column1: Which quote resonates the most with your feminism?
column2: We have begun to raise daughters more like sons  but we should have the courage to raise our sons more like our daughters.
column4: Next time you are about to call a little girl bossy  say instead that she has executive leadership skills.
column6: I am not free while any woman is unfree  even when her shackles are very different from my own.
column8: Many women  I think  resist feminism because it is an agony to be fully conscious of the brutal misogyny which permeates culture  society  and all personal relationships.

column1: What is the most important issue facing modern feminism:
column4: rape culture and sexualized violence against women
column6: making feminism not just about white feminists
column8: women in the workforce; equal pay

column1: Which statement best represents how you feel?
column2: If our economy can't even reflect gender equality (pay gap), how can we expect individuals to be for feminism? A top-down approach is what works.
column4: We have to recognize that the roots of feminism are tainted with racism. Many white feminists used the idea that "How can a black man vote over myself" as a justification for why women should vote.
column6: I am tired of people looking down on being a mother and having a family. These roles are part of a women's identity. It's totally ok to adhere to traditional gender roles.
column8: The patriarchy is too firmly rooted in society, religion, and civilization. A complete overhaul in ideology is necessary in order for there to be ever equality. Other solutions are putting a bandaid over a bullet wound.

column1: If I wanted to take action I would most likely:
column2: Use the feminism movement to advocate for women, and the way that race, sexual orientation, and socioeconomic status affects their life.
column4: Protest beauty pageants-- it's not right that women are being paraded around like livestock.
column6: Write a book like "Lean In" and spread the message through the workforce like Sheryl Sandberg.
column8: Campaign for women in politics-- we need more women leaders, because women have innate, unique qualities that make us great!
